title.native: ラブライブ! School idol project 2期
title.romaji: Love Live! School idol project 2nd Season
title.english: Love Live! School Idol Project 2nd Season

description:
The second season of Love Live! School idol project.

At the intersection of three cities—Akihabara, Kanda, and Jinbocho—the traditional Otonokizaka High was facing a crisis of being closed down. Second-year student, Honoka Kosaka, decided to become a school idol, a trend that has been growing in popularity, in order to increase the number of students applying for her school. With her childhood friends, Kotori Minami and Umi Sonoda, they combined their efforts to form the group, μ's.

A while later, Maki Nishikino, a songwriter, Hanayo Koizumi, who always dreamed of being a school idol, Rin Hoshizora, Hanayo's friend, and Nico Yazawa, the president of the Idol Study Club, joined the group, all with the aim of entering the school idol festival, Love Live.

Additionally, Eli Ayase, the student council president, and Nozomi Tojo, the student council vice president, joined μ's, bringing the group to a total of nine members. After overcoming many problems, ranging from the closing of the school to Kotori's study-abroad incident to μ's going on hiatus, what will the girls aim for next!?

(Source: NIS America)

tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asakonishida) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/24387) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西田亜沙子)

Originating from Studio Muu.


Married to fellow animator [Seiichi Nakatani](https://anilist.co/staff/107409/Seiichi-Nakatani).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1391356994)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asakonishida) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/24387) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西田亜沙子)

Originating from Studio Muu.


Married to fellow animator [Seiichi Nakatani](https://anilist.co/staff/107409/Seiichi-Nakatani).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/64664693)

Yamamoto's interest in working in the anime industry piqued in high school after realizing how noticeable the difference in episodes were depending on the episode director in charge. One of his favourites shows included [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/).

In the late '80s, he joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant after finding out that it's how many of the studio's directors started off. There he met and studied under [Shuuji Iuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/115833/) on his shows [Madou King Granzort](https://anilist.co/anime/2818/) and [Mashin Eiyuuden Wataru](https://anilist.co/anime/4807/). Then after having gone freelance he got his first shot as a director as one of the three unit directors on Iuchi's [Ranma ½ film](https://anilist.co/anime/418/) in 1991.

In 2001, Yamamoto made his debut as a series director on [Shiawase Sou no Okojo-san](https://anilist.co/anime/2934/), soon after which he worked as the first director of the long-running [Keroro Gunsou](https://anilist.co/anime/516/). In 2006 he directed the well-received [NHK ni Youkoso!](https://anilist.co/anime/1210/)

More recent directorial works of his include [Yama no Susume](https://anilist.co/anime/14355/) and [Shounen Maid](https://anilist.co/anime/21321/).

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).

Sakurako’s work is based on her own experiences, with [Sister Princess](https://anilist.co/manga/38414/) coming from having a brother, [Strawberry Panic!](https://anilist.co/manga/34974/) coming from attending an all-girls school, and [Baby Princess](https://anilist.co/manga/38676/) from having a lot of cousins.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroyuki2212)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/andryoh)

Originating from [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/andryoh)

Originating from [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

μ's is a nine-member Japanese voice actress group under Lantis portraying the fictional school idols from the the multimedia project Love Live! The project officially began on June 30, 2010 with the release of a prologue story and character introductions in Dengeki G's Magazine, and their first single ["Bokura no LIVE Kimi to no LIFE"](https://anilist.co/anime/9907/Bokura-no-LIVE-Kimi-to-no-LIFE/) released in August 2010. Their activities ended with their final concert on April 1st, 2016, although they occasionally appear in Love Live events after their group retirement. 

**Members:**
- [Emi Nitta](https://anilist.co/staff/109409/Emi-Nitta) as [Honoka Kousaka](https://anilist.co/character/46171/Honoka-Kousaka)
- [Aya Uchida](https://anilist.co/staff/103921/Aya-Uchida) as [Kotori Minami](https://anilist.co/character/46013/Kotori-Minami)
- [Suzuko Mimori](https://anilist.co/staff/106359/Suzuko-Mimori) as [Umi Sonoda](https://anilist.co/character/46167/Umi-Sonoda)
- [Riho Iida](https://anilist.co/staff/112207/Riho-Iida) as [Rin Hoshizora](https://anilist.co/character/46011/Rin-Hoshizora)
- [Pile](https://anilist.co/staff/112211/Pile) as [Maki Nishikino](https://anilist.co/character/46165/Maki-Nishikino)
- [Yurika Kubo](https://anilist.co/staff/112209/Yurika-Kubo) as [Hanayo Koizumi](https://anilist.co/character/46017/Hanayo-Koizumi)
- [Yoshino Nanjou](https://anilist.co/staff/96592/Yoshino-Nanjou) as [Eli Ayase](https://anilist.co/character/46173/Eli-Ayase)
- [Aina Kusada](https://anilist.co/staff/112213/Aina-Kusuda) as [Nozomi Toujou](https://anilist.co/character/46169/Nozomi-Toujou)
- [Sora Tokui](https://anilist.co/staff/106361/Sora-Tokui) as [Nico Yazawa](https://anilist.co/character/46163/Nico-Yazawa)

__[Archived Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/425)__

__Hiroshi Sasaki__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer and arranger formerly affiliated with Smile Company.
